intro: Metastelma grisebachianum, commonly known as the gray-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees, such as those in the families Euphorbiaceae and Myrtaceae. The plant has scale-like leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers, followed by fleshy, berry-like fruits. It relies on its host for water and nutrients, while still performing photosynthesis to some extent. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
